title: Finals Week Schedule and Transportation Information
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
FINALS 

WEEK

FINALS WEEK

summary:
Finals week runs **Tuesday, December 16 - Friday, December 19**. Students should arrive by **11:10 AM** on 12/17, 12/18, and 12/19, and only need to attend classes with scheduled exams. Buses depart at **2:30 PM** daily.

**Exam Schedule:**
- **Tuesday 12/16**: Full day schedule (0 Bell through 6th period), 7th period exam 1:00-2:30 PM
- **Wednesday 12/17**: 1st period exam 7:55-9:25 AM, break, 2nd period exam 9:40-11:10 AM
- **Thursday 12/18**: 3rd period exam 7:55-9:25 AM, break, 4th period exam 9:40-11:10 AM
- **Friday 12/19**: 5th period exam 7:55-9:25 AM, break, 6th period exam 9:40-11:10 AM

summary:
**Talawanda School District Food Resources:**

- **Little Free Pantries** available 24/7 outside every TSD building, restocked weekly or more as needed
- **Backpack Program** in all elementary buildings - small bag of food provided each week on Thursdays/Fridays (contact your building Social Worker)
- **Emergency Food boxes** available for pick-up or delivery within 24 hours
- **Additional resources** include a [calendar of community meals and TOPPS schedule](Calendar), [list of all Butler County food pantries](List), and [SNAP information](SNAP information)

**Contact your building Social Worker** for assistance accessing these programs.

title: BRAVE Day for Sophomores - November 14th
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
BRAVE 

DAY

BRAVE DAY

BRAVE Day at Talawanda High School is our annual family building and diversity event for our Sophomore class. The focus of the day is on making students realize that they are not alone at Talawanda, and they have many other peers and adults that care about and support them. Our students are a large part of our community, and by sharing stories, participating in activities, and most importantly - listening - they realize the important role they play with their classmates. Since 2009, BRAVE Day has been an influential part of our Anti-bullying, personal empowerment program at THS and our students come out of this experience better people for it.The event will take place…FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 14TH The effort that our students put into the day is an amazing thing to witness. Not only do students participate, they also encourage each other throughout the day on a level that is not normally seen in a typical High School. As a School District we appreciate their willingness to let go of their normal day and try to become a better person. Talawanda is thankful for them, and realizes that we have some of the most caring students around.If you feel your student would not benefit from the day, or would be negatively affected by the activities provided, they are not required to attend. We will not force students to participate, but rather want to provide the opportunity for them to improve as Talawanda students during BRAVE Day. They should stay in class during the event if they do not want to attend.

summary: **BRAVE Day** is Talawanda High School's annual family building, diversity, and anti-bullying event for **sophomores only**, taking place **Friday, November 14th**. The day focuses on helping students realize they're not alone and building community through sharing stories, activities, and listening. Students participate voluntarily and are encouraged to attend, but those who feel they would not benefit may stay in their regular classes instead.

summary:
Talawanda School District provides access to several food assistance resources:
- **[Calendar of community meals and TOPPS schedule](link provided)** - Shows when and where free community meals are available
- **[Complete list of Butler County food pantries](link provided)** - Directory of all local food pantries in the area
- **[SNAP (food assistance) information](link provided)** - Details about applying for government food assistance benefits

Additional resources include Little Free Pantries at all TSD buildings (restocked weekly), Backpack Program at elementary schools (food provided Thursdays/Fridays), and emergency food boxes available within 24 hours.

title: Winter EOC Testing Schedule and Information

blocks.content:
EOC 

TESTING

EOC TESTING

summary:
**Individual Testing (12/3-12/5):** For students needing to meet graduation requirements and first-time testers not taking that class at THS. Contact Mrs. Hess for make-up testing.

**Class Testing (12/16-12/19):** ONLY for students currently taking an Algebra C or Government class, administered during exam week. Make-up testing: 1/7-1/8.

Emails will be sent to students and primary parent/guardian before Thanksgiving Break with specific test details and schedule. Questions should be directed to Mrs. Hess at **hessb@talawanda.org**.

FCCLA

summary: **FCCLA is hosting a blood drive on November 7, 2025** from 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM at the Talawanda Intermediate Auxiliary Gym. The drive addresses the American blood shortage and helps those needing blood for illnesses, transplants, and other medical needs. Healthy individuals aged 16-65 can donate. title: Tech Healthy Household Presentation by Project Reboot
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
PROJECT 

REBOOT

PROJECT REBOOT

summary: **Project Reboot** presents "Keys to Building a Tech Healthy Household" on **Tuesday, November 18th from 6-7:30 PM at Talawanda High School**. The 60-minute presentation plus 30-minute Q&A will cover tech addiction (why it happens and how to overcome it), discussing screen time with kids without conflict, and practical tips for maintaining balanced relationships with technology. Hosted by **Dino Ambrosi**, Founder of Project Reboot and digital wellness presenter who helped 100+ UC Berkeley students reduce screen time and launched a TEDx talk with over 2 million views. All attendees receive actionable resources and dinner table discussion guides. **PD approved for distribution**. Event supported by Greater Oxford Community Foundation. Visit https://projectreboot.school for more information.
